alert.note: Alert for McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central McCulloch and southwestern San Saba Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 351 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Us-190 Near The Mcculloch- San Saba County Line, or 9 miles southeast of Rochelle, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail, along with frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Richland Springs, Algerita, Sloan, Harkeyville and Us- 190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
